title: Kenya’s Election Rounding Error
description: When the official figures were announced in Kenya’s presidential election, it looked like the total percentage share of the vote for each candidate came to more than 100%. As this should not be possible, many wondered if up to 142,000 votes might be miscounted. We explore what turns out to be a simple mathematical misunderstanding of the numbers.
itunes:subtitle: Official figures didn’t add up - but due to rounding, not fraud.
itunes:summary: When the official figures were announced in Kenya’s presidential election, it looked like the total percentage share of the vote for each candidate came to more than 100%. itunes:author: BBC Radio 4
